main event: On 13 March 1955, pilots observed a silvery object resembling a weather balloon while flying over Salton Sea, California.
interesting points: The object was seen at an altitude of 20,000 feet,The pilots estimated the object's speed to be around 251 knots at 43,000 feet,The sighting lasted approximately 3 minutes before the object disappeared,The source of the report was from military pilots,Several possible explanations were given for the sighting including balloon or aircraft.
sighted object: one silvery object the size of a weather balloon
witness description: military pilots of a DC-7 airliner
